results.title: Out of Sight Peace of Mind
results.creator_credit: Brian Hill and A. Stuart Campbell
results.brief_description: Yachts, motor cruisers, fishing vessels and merchant ships that rely on HF radio will soon be covered by a new safety net; the Global Maritime Distress and Safety System, which will combine the latest satellite technology with a number of new HF communications frequencies. The system will be introduced in Australia on 1 July 1991, and it’s vital that offshore mariners become familiar with the changes and the new HF frequencies.

results.title: Out of orbit
results.creator_credit: Jam Handy and Michigan State Board of Alcoholism
results.brief_description: A dramatised case study of the effect of an alcoholic in the family. A boy’s 12th birthday is twisted from a happy occasion to one of despair because his father is an alcoholic. Discusses alcoholism as an illness and suggests ways in which an alcoholic can be helped by clergy, physicians, social workers, public health nurses and the general public.

results.title: Out of darkness
results.creator_credit: David Rittey, Hugh Burton and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: A young girl, Alice (Isabella Giovinazzo), struggles to understand her father’s blindness resulting from an accident and blames herself. Fascinated by the universe, she imagines and wonders about her place in the world but feels connected and a part of the universe, a metaphor for her changing (but growing) understanding. Written and directed by David Rittey.

results.title: Out of breath
results.creator_credit: Phillip Mark-Law, Don Anderson and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A dramatised documentary about occupational asthma. A cabinet maker is faced with the difficult choice between continuing to work in a dusty environment or improving his health.

results.title: Out of a Chinese painting brush (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Produced by the Harmon Foundation in cooperation with the China Institute in America, this film shows us a famous Chinese artist, Chang Shu-Chi at work with a paint-brush. Photographed at actual speed, the film reveals the speed and grace of his technique.

results.title: Out
results.creator_credit: Thorold Dickinson and United Nations. Film Board
results.brief_description: A documentary report on a people’s flight to freedom and of the problems Hungarian escapees face in finding a new home and a new land. Shot in Austria by UN cameramen, the film contains scenes of actual escapes across the border. The film is a moving document, telling the story of a mother and two boys and their search for a new homeland. Powerful and dramatic use of music which was recorded in one of the ninety refugee camps in Austria and haunting images combine to capture the danger and the desperation faced by these people.

results.title: Our wonderful ears and their care
